title: Ingenious Hunter is Incredibly Underrated
body:
When it gets fully stacked, you get **40% CDR on active items.**

To put this in perspective:
> 
* {{item:3146}} {{item:3030}}{{item:3152}}{{item:3814}}  - 24 second cooldown (16 seconds less than normal)
* {{item:3157}}{{item:3040}}{{item:3107}} {{item:3512}} {{item:3060}}{{item:3222}}    - 72 second cooldown (48 seconds less than normal)
* {{item:3077}} {{item:3074}}  - 6 second cooldown (4 seconds less than normal)
* {{item:3748}} - 12 second cooldown (8 seconds less than normal)
* {{item:3143}} {{item:3140}} {{item:3137}} {{item:3193}} {{item:3905}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3800}}{{item:3153}}   - 54 second cooldown (36 seconds less than normal)
* {{item:3142}} - 27 second cooldown (18 seconds less than normal)
* Predator boots go from (150 - 100 seconds) to (90 - 60 seconds)

I usually run it on my Predator Kayn set up. I'm just sad that ppl aren't noticing on how much of an impact this rune has on active items.

I don't take it, but just because of how much insane sustain that taking RH gives you.   As Kayn you also are prone to only having 2 items that benefit (Ghostblade and the trinket) as EoN isn't a must-buy, and Duskblade doesn't get any benefit.  Pred means you are giving up a lot of early game power for a bit of a gank assist, but Kayn doesn't need such a gank assist because he has so many options of where to come from, he doesn't need the added help of being able to run someone down.  And if you were taking Pred for the speed boost, you may as well just take the out of combat MS rune instead, which gets you the same exact benefit of faster movement, only its all the time.   Its also less damage than electrocute (which has a lower CD) and Dark Harvest can outscale it easily (especially on Kayn, practically the best farming assassin jungler to have ever existed on sheer raw capability to pull in CS, especially with his godlike waveclear in the mid to late game with his W being able to 1 shot not just casters, but also melee minions, while they are still in line formation).

For me, the general Kayn setup is Electro-Sudden-Zombie-Rav-Celerity- and either Scorch, or Gathering Storm, depending on how long I think the game will go based on general comps.

Ehh... a lot of those changes just ensure the items will be up if you fight twice in quick succession. In a single fight, your still unlikely to get a second usage out of anything except tiamat. 

Not saying its bad, cause maybe you do get into a situation where you get a second fight not long afterwards and the shorter CDs make a difference, but it can be basically a dead rune in a single engage. Having the potential to be effectively useless in a single fight is a big deal when you consider its up against almost certain healing in a fight or consistant improved map mobility.

I don't think it's underrated, it's just not used as much because:
1) Most of these actives are coming on later in the game, making the rune useless for the most part. Only maybe the Tiamat, Gunblade and BorK are the items you get at the early game and out of those, only the Gunblade can be abused for its lower cooldown.
2) Rune still needs to stack up, which means you need to get kills / assists for it to work well, which isn't always the case.
3) Most of these actives aren't as useful, or do not really need the extra CDR. For example, a Stoneplate doesn't really need it. You use it, you win a fight, then you push, take Baron etc and you will have it back up regardless of the extra CDR. Sure, you can say that having Protobelt more often means you can go for more often aggressive trades with someone like Ekko or Vladimir, but you need to realize that you probably need to have your ult up to all in effectively, so the Protobelt will have its CD reset by the time you get your ult back.
4) Most importantly, not a lot of champions make effective use of this tree. Supports who could definitely use a more often Locket / Redemption / Mikael's etc will rarely go into this tree. ADCs generally go for 1st + 3rd, Mages go for 3rd + 5th, top laners go for 4th + 5th mostly etc. You get my point.
5) The extra movement speed you get, even out of combat, is really important. Early game, where you probably back often, will help you get back in lane and not miss a lot of cs, later it will help you rotate fast, assuming you have stacked it already, and is really good for junglers who spend most of their time roaming around the map. Don't forget, the MS bonus is something you get from the start of the game and can make instant use of.
